DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Unified Code for Units of Measure symbols that represent a determinate amount or quantity used as the standard of measurement for the circumference of an object.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

Property.preferredDefinition: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.:A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

Concepts.definition: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.
A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

DataElementConcept.origin: 2015 Edition Common Clinical Data Set - 45 CFR 170.102
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to support MU Data Elements for ONC

ValueDomain.preferredName: Length Unified Code for Units of Measure Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The Unified Code for Units of Measure symbols that represent a determinate amount or quantity used as the standard of measurement for the size, magnitude or capacity of the distinguishing qualities or prominent aspects of an individual person._The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end._A code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. Its purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). Meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards.

Concepts.definition: A unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). A meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional unit of length defined by the U.S. National Bureau of Standards as 30.48 centimeters. It is equal to 0.3048 meter, 12 inches, or to approximately 0.999998 survey foot.

Concepts.definition: A traditional unit of length defined by the U.S. National Bureau of Standards as 30.48 centimeters. It is equal to 0.3048 meter, 12 inches, or to approximately 0.999998 survey foot.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/12/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional unit of length equal to 1/12 of a foot or 2.54 centimeters.

Concepts.definition: A traditional unit of length equal to 1/12 of a foot or 2.54 centimeters.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to VM and added Inch as alt VM Name. mc 10/21/15

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Length Unified Code for Units of Measure Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.:A code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. Its purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

Concepts.longName: Unified Code for Units of Measure
Concepts.definition: A code system intended to include all units of measures being contemporarily used in international science, engineering, and business. Its purpose is to facilitate unambiguous electronic communication of quantities together with their units.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
